title: Why Trump wants to make America the 'crypto capital of the planet'
description: In 2021, Trump was an outspoken critic of digital currencies, telling Newsmax, "I'm not a fan of bitcoin and other cryptocurrencies, which are not money, and whose value is highly volatile and based on thin air." At a June 27 Bitcoin conference in Nashville, Trump told attendees that if he is elected again to the presidency, he would make the United States "the crypto capital of the planet." He also promised to fire government regulators who have been critical of the industry.
content: The former president's views of virtual coins have shifted markedly in recognition of the emergence of this sector as a major player in campaign finance.
